column2: ARIZONA DMV WRITTEN TEST
Question Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. What does the pictured signal indicate?
column4: A pedestrian may not not begin crossing the street.
column8: A pedestrian may begin crossing the street.

column2: 2. A flashing red light means:
column4: The light will soon change to steady red.
column8: The same as a STOP sign.

column2: 3. You should use turn signals to indicate your intention with sufficient time to allow other drivers to see the signal:
column8: AFTER you move.

column2: 4. Destination signs are ______ with ____ letters and symbols.
column8: green; white

column2: 5. The picture shows a _________ sign.
column8: sharp turn

column2: 6. This road sign means:
column8: Divided highway begins

column2: 7. A red arrow on a traffic light means:
column4: You may turn in in the direction of the arrow after coming to a complete stop.
column6: You must stop and then proceed when the way is clear.
column8: You may not turn in the direction of the arrow until a green light or arrow light goes on.

column2: 8. If your car goes into water, you should:
column4: remove yourself before it starts to sink.
column6: wait for water to rush in and let it out in small breaths through your nose.
column8: call the fire department immediately.

column2: 9. This road sign means:
column8: Crossroads ahead

column2: 10. When an aggressive driver confronts you, you should:
column8: All of the above.

column2: 11. A flashing yellow light:
column6: warns drivers to proceed with caution.
column8: All of the above.

column2: 12. This road sign means:
column4: Drivers cannot make a complete turn to go in the opposite direction.
column6: Vehicles turning left must make a U-turn.
column8: Left turns are not allowed where this sign is displayed.

column2: 13. If the entrance lane is too short to allow acceleration to highway speed, you should:
column4: merge into highway traffic as soon as possible.
column6: go to the next entrance ramp.
column8: stop and wait for a large gap in traffic, then enter the highway and accelerate quickly.

column2: 14. This sign warns drivers that:
column8: they will soon be facing oncoming traffic.

column2: 15. To drive defensively, you must:
column8: keep one hand on the steering wheel.

column2: 16. When they see this sign, drivers should:
column4: be ready to brake sharply and stop.
column6: be ready to shift to lower gear.
column8: yield to trucks coming from the hill on the right.

column2: 17. When changing lanes, you should remember that:
column4: You only need to turn and look over your right shoulder for lane changes to the right or left.
column6: you should look over your left shoulder for a left lane change and your right shoulder for a right lane change.
column8: vehicles with two outside mirrors have no blind spots.

column2: 18. At a stop sign there is no stop line, you must stop:
column8: before you enter the crosswalk.

column2: 19. If a vehicle is coming towards you at night with its high beams on, making it hard to see the road ahead, you should:
column4: look straight ahead towards the middle of the lane.
column6: look ahead towards the right edge of your lane.
column8: look ahead towards the left edge of your lane.

column2: 20. Before you change lanes, you should:
column4: look for other traffic by turning your head and looking behind you for oncoming traffic.
column8: keep other vehicles out of your blind spots.

column2: 21. An edge line that angles toward the center of the road indicates that:
column8: you must turn right.

column2: 22. This sign indicates:
column8: a cross road.

column2: 23. Blind spots are:
column4: At night, the darkest areas of a road, where emergency flashers should be used.
column6: Areas to the side or rear of a vehicle that the driver cannot see with use of mirrors.
column8: Dangerous intersection where the maximum speed limit is 15 MPH or less.

column2: 24. Two drivers reach an uncontrolled intersection at the same time. Who has the right of way?
column8: No one.

column2: 25. What should drivers do in case of a brake failure?
column8: Tie a white cloth on the left door handle.

column2: 26. The octagonal shape is used:
column4: for stop signs and railroad advance warning signs.
column8: to warn drivers of existing or possible hazards on roadways.

column2: 27. One broken line indicates:
column4: You can change lanes, but only when traffic conditions or obstructions in the road make it necessary.
column6: You can not pass other vehicles or go across the line.
column8: You can pass other vehicles and change lanes, if it is safe.

column2: 28. A solid yellow line next to a broken yellow line means that vehicles:
column6: next to the solid line may pass.
column8: next to the broken line may pass.

column2: 29. What should drivers do when they see this sign?
column4: Make sure the bridge is clear of oncoming traffic before they cross.
column6: Look to the left and right for other traffic.
column8: Allow others to merge smoothly.

column2: 30. When approaching an intersection where the traffic light changes from green to yellow, you should:
column4: slow down and proceed with caution through the intersection.
column6: speed up to beat the red light.
column8: come to a safe stop.
